gw.webservice.ab.ab800

Class MaintenanceToolsAPI

  • gw.webservice.ab.ab800.MaintenanceToolsAPI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

    public class MaintenanceToolsAPI
implements _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject
    An API used for managing the application. This is distinct from ISystemToolsAPI which is concerned with managing the application platform.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class _proxy_.gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

        IntrinsicType

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MaintenanceToolsAPI()

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ProcessStatus batchProcessStatusByID(ProcessID pid)
      Gets the status of a particular batch process invocation. If that invocation is still running, the status will indicate as much, and only the startDate and opsCompleted fields will be filled in. Otherwise the returned object will contain information about the completed run (see ProcessStatus for information about all the fields returned).
      ProcessStatus batchProcessStatusByName(String processName)
      Gets the status of the given batch process, indicating whether or not the process is running and, if so, its current progress.
      UpdateTableStatisticsData[] getIncrementalUpdateTableStatisticsData()
      Obtains the set of SQL statements that are required to update database statistics based on user specific threshold value that specifies percentage of table has been modified
      int getNumActiveWorkItems(String queueName)
      Retrieves the number of active work items for a queue
      UpdateTableStatisticsData[] getUpdateTableStatisticsData()
      Obtains the set of SQL statements that are required to update database statistics
      String[] getValidBatchProcessNames()
      Return the set of valid batch process names
      WQueueStatus getWQueueStatus(String queueName)
      Retrieves the status of active executors for that particular queue. Each executor contains information about last 25 workers ran by each executor.
      WorkQueueConfig getWorkQueueConfig(String queueName)
      Get the current configuration of distributed workers for the specified work queue.
      String[] getWorkQueueNames()
      Returns the list of work queue names for this product. These names may be used in {@link #getWorkQueueConfig} and {@link #setWorkQueueConfig}.
      boolean isBatchProcessNameValid(String processName)
      Return whether a given batch process name is valid
      boolean isPluginStarted(String pluginName)
      whether the plugin is started.
      void notifyQueueWorkers(String queueName)
      Wakes up all workers for the specified queue across the cluster. Workers will check for workitems and will continue processing any found until the workitem table for the queue is empty.
      boolean requestTerminationOfBatchProcessByID(ProcessID pid)
      Requests termination of the given batch process, if it's currently running. Note that it's possible that this particular invocation could have finished and another invocation of the same process begun, in which case this won't request the termination of the current invocation. This method does not wait for the batch process to actually terminate
      boolean requestTerminationOfBatchProcessByName(String processName)
      Requests termination of the given batch process, if it's currently running. This method does not wait for the batch process to actually terminate
      void setWorkQueueConfig(String queueName, WorkQueueConfig config)
      Sets the configuration for distributed workers for the specified work queue. Any currently running worker instances will be stopped after the current workitem in process is completed. New worker instances as specified by the passed in config will be created and started. Note that the changes made here are temporary; if the server is restarted, the initial values from config.xml will be used when creating and starting workers.
      ProcessID startBatchProcess(String processName)
      Starts the given batch process. If the process is already running on the server, an exception will be thrown.
      void startPlugin(String pluginName)
      Starts the given startable plugin.
      void startWorkQueueWorkers(String queueName)
      This will start the workqueue workers
      void stopPlugin(String pluginName)
      Stop the given startable plugin.
      void stopWorkQueueWorkers(String queueName)
      This will stop the specified ied work queue.
      boolean waitOnActiveWorkItems(String queueName)
      Wait on the active work items for a queue

      • startBatchProcess

        ProcessID startBatchProcess(String processName)
        Starts the given batch process. If the process is already running on the server, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        processName - the name of the batch process to start
        Returns:
        the ProcessID of the process that was started

      • requestTerminationOfBatchProcessByName

        boolean requestTerminationOfBatchProcessByName(String processName)
        Requests termination of the given batch process, if it's currently running. This method does not wait for the batch process to actually terminate
        Parameters:
        processName - the name of the batch process for which to request termination
        Returns:
        true if the request was successful, false if the process could not be terminated

      • requestTerminationOfBatchProcessByID

        boolean requestTerminationOfBatchProcessByID(ProcessID pid)
        Requests termination of the given batch process, if it's currently running. Note that it's possible that this particular invocation could have finished and another invocation of the same process begun, in which case this won't request the termination of the current invocation. This method does not wait for the batch process to actually terminate
        Parameters:
        pid - the process ID of the process for which to request termination
        Returns:
        true if the request was successful, false if the process could not be terminated

      • batchProcessStatusByName

        ProcessStatus batchProcessStatusByName(String processName)
        Gets the status of the given batch process, indicating whether or not the process is running and, if so, its current progress.
        Parameters:
        processName - the name of the process to retrieve the status of
        Returns:
        the status of that particular process

      • batchProcessStatusByID

        ProcessStatus batchProcessStatusByID(ProcessID pid)
        Gets the status of a particular batch process invocation. If that invocation is still running, the status will indicate as much, and only the startDate and opsCompleted fields will be filled in. Otherwise the returned object will contain information about the completed run (see ProcessStatus for information about all the fields returned).
        Parameters:
        pid - the process ID to retrieve the status of
        Returns:
        the status of that particular process invocation

      • getUpdateTableStatisticsData

        UpdateTableStatisticsData[] getUpdateTableStatisticsData()
        Obtains the set of SQL statements that are required to update database statistics
        Returns:
        An array of UpdateTableStatisticsData items, one for each table that has updateable statistics

      • getIncrementalUpdateTableStatisticsData

        UpdateTableStatisticsData[] getIncrementalUpdateTableStatisticsData()
        Obtains the set of SQL statements that are required to update database statistics based on user specific threshold value that specifies percentage of table has been modified
        Returns:
        An array of UpdateTableStatisticsData items, one for each table that has updateable statistics

      • getWorkQueueConfig

        WorkQueueConfig getWorkQueueConfig(String queueName)
        Get the current configuration of distributed workers for the specified work queue.
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue to query
        Returns:
        A WorkQueueConfig instance containing the current settings

      • setWorkQueueConfig

        void setWorkQueueConfig(String queueName,
                      WorkQueueConfig config)
        Sets the configuration for distributed workers for the specified work queue. Any currently running worker instances will be stopped after the current workitem in process is completed. New worker instances as specified by the passed in config will be created and started. Note that the changes made here are temporary; if the server is restarted, the initial values from config.xml will be used when creating and starting workers.
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue to modify
        config - The configuration to establish.

      • getWorkQueueNames

        String[] getWorkQueueNames()
        Returns the list of work queue names for this product. These names may be used in {@link #getWorkQueueConfig} and {@link #setWorkQueueConfig}.
        Returns:

      • notifyQueueWorkers

        void notifyQueueWorkers(String queueName)
        Wakes up all workers for the specified queue across the cluster. Workers will check for workitems and will continue processing any found until the workitem table for the queue is empty.
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue to notify workers

      • stopWorkQueueWorkers

        void stopWorkQueueWorkers(String queueName)
        This will stop the specified ied work queue.
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue

      • startWorkQueueWorkers

        void startWorkQueueWorkers(String queueName)
        This will start the workqueue workers
        Parameters:
        queueName - Name of the queue
